page.title: 17THE BROOK,HILTON
page.content: In 1979 the Severn Trent Water Authority decided to divert the course of Hilton Brook because it kept flooding all the fields and some houses.They dug out a new channel for the brook and made it deeper and wider so it wouldnt flood.The old brook has been blocked off by a small dam to stop the water from getting in to the old brook except for when the new brook floods.In 1983 the water Authority completed a survey of fish in the brook.Here is a list of the fish found there: Chub,dace,loach, trout,gudgeon,grayling,minnows, bullhead,stickleback,pike and perch. During the summer months many people from the village spend time by the brook,as it is an ideal place for picnics and walking.
